				SetMinRowsVisible forces a multi-line entry to show `count` number of rows without scrolling.
				This is not a validation or requirement, it just impacts the minimum visible size.

		Form widget is two column grid where each row has a label and a widget (usually an input).
		The last row of the grid will contain the appropriate form control buttons if any should be shown.
		Setting OnSubmit will set the submit button to be visible and call back the function when tapped.
		Setting OnCancel will do the same for a cancel button.
		If you change OnSubmit/OnCancel after the form is created and rendered, you need to call
		Refresh() to update the form with the correct buttons.
		Setting OnSubmit/OnCancel to nil will remove the buttons.

		Menu is a widget for displaying a fyne.Menu.

		
			BaseWidget BaseWidget
			BaseWidget.Hidden bool
			Items []fyne.CanvasObject
			OnDismiss func()
			
			activeItem *menuItem
			alignment fyne.TextAlign
			BaseWidget.impl atomic.Pointer[fyne.Widget]
			BaseWidget.position async.Position
			BaseWidget.propertyLock sync.RWMutex
			BaseWidget.size async.Size
			BaseWidget.themeCache fyne.Theme
			containsCheck bool
			customSized bool
		
			
				ActivateLastSubmenu finds the last active menu item traversing through the open submenus
				and activates its submenu if any.
				It returns `true` if there was a submenu and it was activated and `false` elsewhere.
				Activating a submenu does show it and activate its first item.

			
				ActivateNext activates the menu item following the currently active menu item.
				If there is no menu item active, it activates the first menu item.
				If there is no menu item after the current active one, it does nothing.
				If a submenu is open, it delegates the activation to this submenu.

			
				ActivatePrevious activates the menu item preceding the currently active menu item.
				If there is no menu item active, it activates the last menu item.
				If there is no menu item before the current active one, it does nothing.
				If a submenu is open, it delegates the activation to this submenu.

			
				CreateRenderer returns a new renderer for the menu.
				
				Implements: fyne.Widget

			
				DeactivateChild deactivates the active menu item and hides its submenu if any.

			
				DeactivateLastSubmenu finds the last open submenu traversing through the open submenus,
				deactivates its active item and hides it.
				This also deactivates any submenus of the deactivated submenu.
				It returns `true` if there was a submenu open and closed and `false` elsewhere.

			
				Dismiss dismisses the menu by dismissing and hiding the active child and performing OnDismiss.

			
				ExtendBaseWidget is used by an extending widget to make use of BaseWidget functionality.

			
				Hide this widget so it is no longer visible

			
				MinSize returns the minimal size of the menu.
				
				Implements: fyne.Widget

			
				Move the widget to a new position, relative to its parent.
				Note this should not be used if the widget is being managed by a Layout within a Container.

			
				Position gets the current position of this widget, relative to its parent.

			
				Refresh updates the menu to reflect changes in the data.
				
				Implements: fyne.Widget

			
				Resize sets a new size for a widget.
				Note this should not be used if the widget is being managed by a Layout within a Container.

			
				Show this widget so it becomes visible

			
				Size gets the current size of this widget.

			
				Tapped catches taps on separators and the menu background. It doesn't perform any action.
				
				Implements: fyne.Tappable

			
				Theme returns a cached Theme instance for this widget (or its extending widget).
				This will be the app theme in most cases, or a widget specific theme if it is inside a ThemeOverride container.
				
				Since: 2.5

			
				TriggerLast finds the last active menu item traversing through the open submenus and triggers it.

			
				Visible returns whether or not this widget should be visible.
				Note that this may not mean it is currently visible if a parent has been hidden.

			
			(*Menu) activateItem(item *menuItem)

		Table widget is a grid of items that can be scrolled and a cell selected.
		Its performance is provided by caching cell templates created with CreateCell and re-using them with UpdateCell.
		The size of the content rows/columns is returned by the Length callback.
		
		Since: 1.4

		
			BaseWidget BaseWidget
			BaseWidget.Hidden bool
			CreateCell func() fyne.CanvasObject
			
				CreateHeader is an optional function that allows overriding of the default header widget.
				Developers must also override `UpdateHeader`.
				
				Since: 2.4

			
				HideSeparators hides the separator lines between the table cells
				
				Since: 2.5

			Length func() (rows int, cols int)
			OnSelected func(id TableCellID)
			OnUnselected func(id TableCellID)
			
				ShowHeaderColumn specifies that a column should be added to the table with header content.
				This will default to an 1-10 style numeric content, unless overridden with `CreateHeader` and `UpdateHeader` calls.
				
				Since: 2.4

			
				ShowHeaderRow specifies that a row should be added to the table with header content.
				This will default to an A-Z style content, unless overridden with `CreateHeader` and `UpdateHeader` calls.
				
				Since: 2.4

			
				StickyColumnCount specifies how many data columns should not scroll when the content moves.
				If `ShowHeaderColumn` us `true` then the stuck column will appear immediately next to the header.
				
				Since: 2.4

			
				StickyRowCount specifies how many data rows should not scroll when the content moves.
				If `ShowHeaderRow` us `true` then the stuck row will appear immediately underneath.
				
				Since: 2.4

			UpdateCell func(id TableCellID, template fyne.CanvasObject)
			
				UpdateHeader is used with `CreateHeader` to support custom header content.
				The `id` parameter will have `-1` value to indicate a header, and `> 0` where the column or row refer to data.
				
				Since: 2.4

			
			BaseWidget.impl atomic.Pointer[fyne.Widget]
			BaseWidget.position async.Position

			BaseWidget.size async.Size

		TextGrid is a monospaced grid of characters.
		This is designed to be used by a text editor, code preview or terminal emulator.

		
			BaseWidget BaseWidget
			BaseWidget.Hidden bool
			Rows []TextGridRow
			ShowLineNumbers bool
			ShowWhitespace bool
			
				// If set to 0 the fyne.DefaultTabWidth is used

			BaseWidget.position async.Position
			BaseWidget.propertyLock sync.RWMutex
			BaseWidget.size async.Size
			BaseWidget.themeCache fyne.Theme
		
			
				CreateRenderer is a private method to Fyne which links this widget to it's renderer

			
				ExtendBaseWidget is used by an extending widget to make use of BaseWidget functionality.

			
				Hide this widget so it is no longer visible

			
				MinSize returns the smallest size this widget can shrink to

			
				Move the widget to a new position, relative to its parent.
				Note this should not be used if the widget is being managed by a Layout within a Container.

			
				Position gets the current position of this widget, relative to its parent.

			
				Refresh causes this widget to be redrawn in it's current state

			
				Resize is called when this widget changes size. We should make sure that we refresh cells.

			
				Row returns a copy of the content in a specified row as a TextGridRow.
				If the index is out of bounds it returns an empty row object.

			
				RowText returns a string representation of the content at the row specified.
				If the index is out of bounds it returns an empty string.

			
				SetCell sets a grid data to the cell at named row and column.

			
				SetRow updates the specified row of the grid's contents using the specified content and style and then refreshes.
				If the row is beyond the end of the current buffer it will be expanded.
				Tab characters are not padded with spaces.

			
				SetRowStyle sets a grid style to all the cells cell at the specified row.
				Any cells in this row with their own style will override this value when displayed.

			
				SetRune sets a character to the cell at named row and column.

			
				SetStyle sets a grid style to the cell at named row and column.

			
				SetStyleRange sets a grid style to all the cells between the start row and column through to the end row and column.

			
				SetText updates the buffer of this textgrid to contain the specified text.
				New lines and columns will be added as required. Lines are separated by '\n'.
				The grid will use default text style and any previous content and style will be removed.
				Tab characters are padded with spaces to the next tab stop.

			
				Show this widget so it becomes visible

			
				Size gets the current size of this widget.

			
				Text returns the contents of the buffer as a single string (with no style information).
				It reconstructs the lines by joining with a `\n` character.
				Tab characters have padded spaces removed.

			
				Theme returns a cached Theme instance for this widget (or its extending widget).
				This will be the app theme in most cases, or a widget specific theme if it is inside a ThemeOverride container.
				
				Since: 2.5

			
				Visible returns whether or not this widget should be visible.
				Note that this may not mean it is currently visible if a parent has been hidden.

				tabWidth either returns the set tab width or if not set the returns the DefaultTabWidth

			(*entryContentRenderer) Refresh()
			
			
				This process builds a slice of rectangles:
				- one entry per row of text
				- ordered by row order as they occur in multiline text
				This process could be optimized in the scenario where the user is selecting upwards:
				If the upwards case instead produces an order-reversed slice then only the newest rectangle would
				require movement and resizing. The existing solution creates a new rectangle and then moves/resizes
				all rectangles to comply with the occurrence order as stated above.

		entryMergeableUndoAction is like entryUndoAction, but the undoStack
		can try to merge it with the next action (see TryMerge).
		This is useful because it allows grouping together actions like
		entering every single characters in a word. We don't want to have to
		undo every single character addition.

		
			( entryMergeableUndoAction) Redo(string) string
			
				TryMerge attempts to merge the current action
				with the next action. It returns true if successful.
				If it fails, the undoStack will simply add the next
				item without merging.

			( entryMergeableUndoAction) Undo(string) string
		
			
			*entryModifyAction
		
			
			 entryMergeableUndoAction : entryUndoAction


	
		entryModifyAction implements entryMergeableUndoAction.
		It represents the insertion/deletion of a single string at a
		position (e.g. "Hello" => "Hello, world", or "Hello" => "He").

		
			
				Delete is true if this action deletes Text, and false if it inserts Text

			
				Position represents the start position of Text

			
				Text is the text that is inserted or deleted at Position

		
			(*entryModifyAction) Redo(s string) string
			(*entryModifyAction) TryMerge(other entryMergeableUndoAction) bool
			(*entryModifyAction) Undo(s string) string
			
			
				Inserts Text

			
				Deletes Text

		
			
			*entryModifyAction : entryMergeableUndoAction
			*entryModifyAction : entryUndoAction

			( entryUndoAction) Undo(string) string
		
			
			 entryMergeableUndoAction (interface)
			*entryModifyAction


	
		entryUndoStack stores the information necessary for textual undo/redo functionality.

		
			
			
				index is the size of the current effective undo stack.
				items[index-1] and below are the possible undo actions.
				items[index] and above are the possible redo actions.

			
				items is the stack for storing the history of user actions.

		
			
				Adds the action to the stack, which can later be undone by calling Undo()

			
				Returns true if an redo action is available

			
				Returns true if an undo action is available

			
				Removes all items from the undo stack

			
				Tries to merge the action with the last item on the undo stack.
				If it can't be merged, it calls Add().

			
				Applies the redo action to s and returns the result along with the action performed

			
				Applies the undo action to s and returns the result along with the action performed

				It does nothing if the item doesn’t have an action.
				
				Implements: fyne.Tappable

				Note that this may not mean it is currently visible if a parent has been hidden.

			Pool sync.Pool
			
				New optionally specifies a function to generate
				a value when Get would otherwise return nil.
				It may not be changed concurrently with calls to Get.

			
			
				// local fixed-size per-P pool, actual type is [P]poolLocal

			
				// size of the local array

			Pool.noCopy sync.noCopy
			
				// local from previous cycle

			
				// size of victims array

		
			
				Get selects an arbitrary item from the [Pool], removes it from the
				Pool, and returns it to the caller.
				Get may choose to ignore the pool and treat it as empty.
				Callers should not assume any relation between values passed to [Pool.Put] and
				the values returned by Get.
				
				If Get would otherwise return nil and p.New is non-nil, Get returns
				the result of calling p.New.

			
				Obtain returns an item from the pool for use

			
				Put adds x to the pool.

			
				Release adds an item into the pool to be used later

			
			(*syncPool) getSlow(pid int) any
			
				pin pins the current goroutine to P, disables preemption and
				returns poolLocal pool for the P and the P's id.
				Caller must call runtime_procUnpin() when done with the pool.

			(*syncPool) pinSlow() (*sync.poolLocal, int)
		
			
			*syncPool : pool

		NewProgressBar creates a new progress bar widget.
		The default Min is 0 and Max is 1, Values set should be between those numbers.
		The display will convert this to a percentage.


	
		NewProgressBarInfinite creates a new progress bar widget that loops indefinitely from 0% -> 100%
		SetValue() is not defined for infinite progress bar
		To stop the looping progress and set the progress bar to 100%, call ProgressBarInfinite.Stop()

		If no segments are specified it will be converted to a single segment using the default text settings.

		NewTable returns a new performant table widget defined by the passed functions.
		The first returns the data size in rows and columns, second parameter is a function that returns cell
		template objects that can be cached and the third is used to apply data at specified data location to the
		passed template CanvasObject.
		
		Since: 1.4


	
		NewTableWithHeaders returns a new performant table widget defined by the passed functions including sticky headers.
		The first returns the data size in rows and columns, second parameter is a function that returns cell
		template objects that can be cached and the third is used to apply data at specified data location to the
		passed template CanvasObject.
		The row and column headers will stick to the leading and top edges of the table and contain "1-10" and "A-Z" formatted labels.
		
		Since: 2.4

		NewTree returns a new performant tree widget defined by the passed functions.
		childUIDs returns the child TreeNodeIDs of the given node.
		isBranch returns true if the given node is a branch, false if it is a leaf.
		create returns a new template object that can be cached.
		update is used to apply data at specified data location to the passed template CanvasObject.
		
		Since: 1.4


	
		NewTreeWithData creates a new tree widget that will display the contents of the provided data.
		
		Since: 2.4


	
		NewTreeWithStrings creates a new tree with the given string map.
		Data must contain a mapping for the root, which defaults to empty string ("").
		
		Since: 1.4


	
		ShowModalPopUp creates a new popUp for the specified content and displays it on the passed canvas.
		A modal PopUp blocks interactions with underlying elements, covered with a semi-transparent overlay.


	
		ShowPopUp creates a new popUp for the specified content and displays it on the passed canvas.


	
		ShowPopUpAtPosition creates a new popUp for the specified content at the specified absolute position.
		It will then display the popup on the passed canvas.


	
		ShowPopUpAtRelativePosition shows a new popUp for the specified content at the given position relative to stated object.
		It will then display the popup on the passed canvas.

		ShowPopUpMenuAtPosition creates a PopUp menu populated with items from the passed menu structure.

		ShowPopUpMenuAtRelativePosition creates a PopUp menu populated with meny items from the passed menu structure.
		It will automatically be positioned at the given position relative to stated object and shown as an overlay on the specified canvas.
